_comment: Glossary terms organized by category. Children reference their parent by 'parent' key (matched by name). Order matters: parents must appear before children.

terms.name: Data Governance
terms.definition: The framework for managing data availability, usability, integrity, and security within an organization.

terms.name: Personal Identifiable Information (PII)
terms.definition: Any data that can be used to identify a specific individual, including name, email, address, phone number, and government IDs.

terms.name: GDPR Compliance
terms.definition: Adherence to the General Data Protection Regulation, the EU law on data protection and privacy.

terms.name: Data Retention Policy
terms.definition: Rules defining how long data should be kept before being archived or deleted.

terms.name: Data Architecture
terms.definition: The structural design of data systems, including models, policies, and standards governing data collection, storage, and use.

terms.name: Event Streaming
terms.definition: A data integration pattern where events are published to a stream and consumed by one or more subscribers in real-time.

terms.name: Data Lake
terms.definition: A centralized repository that stores raw data in its native format until it is needed for analytics.

terms.name: Data Lineage
terms.definition: The tracking of data from its origin through all transformations, movements, and consumption points.

terms.name: Business Intelligence
terms.definition: Tools and strategies for analyzing business data to support decision-making.

terms.name: KPI - Key Performance Indicator
terms.definition: A measurable value that demonstrates how effectively an organization is achieving key business objectives.

terms.name: Revenue Analytics
terms.definition: The analysis of income data to identify trends, forecast earnings, and optimize pricing strategies.

terms.name: Customer Segmentation
terms.definition: The process of dividing customers into groups based on shared characteristics like demographics, behavior, or purchase history.

terms.name: Data Quality
terms.definition: The degree to which data meets the requirements of its intended use in terms of accuracy, completeness, and consistency.

terms.name: Data Completeness
terms.definition: A measure of whether all required data fields are populated and no expected records are missing.

terms.name: Data Freshness
terms.definition: A measure of how up-to-date data is relative to real-world events it represents.

terms.name: Data Accuracy
terms.definition: The degree to which data correctly describes the real-world entity or event it represents.
